Key to the families of Dicotyledons

source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Euphorbiaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1999). Euphorbiaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves narrow-linear with revolute margins, mostly less than 2 cm long and less than 3 mm wide; female flowers sessile
Leaves oblong-linear, flat, 2–7 cm long, 3–8 mm wide; female flowers on stout peduncles 1–5 mm long
Branchlets and young foliage more or less glabrous; leaves resinous and sticky; male perianth lobes c. 2 mm long; ovary glabrous; upper Mitchell, Snowy and Wellington Rivers

Branchlets and young foliage greyish or yellowish from the stellate indumentum; leaves non-resinous; male perianth lobes c. 4 mm long; ovary usually densely stellate-hairy; north-west Victoria and upper Mitta Mitta River
Young branchlets with pale golden-yellow indumentum; petioles 1.5–3.5 mm long; eastern Vic.
Young branchlets with whitish indumentum; petioles 0.9–1.5 mm long; Grampians
